name: campaign_forecasting
description:
This model generates monthly performance forecasts for marketing campaigns at the company level.
It combines historical aggregated campaign data with time series forecasting techniques (moving averages, growth rates, seasonality)
to project key metrics (Conversion Rate, ROI, Acquisition Cost, CTR) for the next 3 months.
The model outputs both historical actuals and future forecasts, including confidence intervals based on historical volatility.
It uses SQL-based methods suitable for environments like DuckDB without external ML dependencies.

columns.name: Company
columns.description: The name of the company for which campaign metrics are aggregated and forecasted.

columns.name: month_id
columns.description: Numeric representation of the year and month (Format: YYYYMM). Used as the primary time dimension for ordering and joining.

columns.name: month
columns.description: The calendar month number (1-12).

columns.name: year
columns.description: The calendar year (Format: YYYY).

columns.name: conversion_rate
columns.description: Historical average monthly conversion rate for the company's campaigns. Null for forecast periods.

columns.name: conversion_rate_forecast
columns.description: Forecasted average monthly conversion rate. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: conversion_rate_lower_bound
columns.description: Lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for the conversion rate forecast. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: conversion_rate_upper_bound
columns.description: Upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the conversion rate forecast. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: roi
columns.description: Historical average monthly Return on Investment (ROI) for the company's campaigns. Null for forecast periods.

columns.name: roi_forecast
columns.description: Forecasted average monthly ROI. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: roi_lower_bound
columns.description: Lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for the ROI forecast. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: roi_upper_bound
columns.description: Upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the ROI forecast. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: acquisition_cost
columns.description: Historical average monthly Acquisition Cost (e.g., Cost Per Acquisition - CPA) for the company's campaigns. Null for forecast periods.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_forecast
columns.description: Forecasted average monthly Acquisition Cost. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_lower_bound
columns.description: Lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for the Acquisition Cost forecast. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: acquisition_cost_upper_bound
columns.description: Upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the Acquisition Cost forecast. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: ctr
columns.description: Historical average monthly Click-Through Rate (CTR) for the company's campaigns. Null for forecast periods.

columns.name: ctr_forecast
columns.description: Forecasted average monthly CTR. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: ctr_lower_bound
columns.description: Lower bound of the 95% confidence interval for the CTR forecast. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: ctr_upper_bound
columns.description: Upper bound of the 95% confidence interval for the CTR forecast. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: is_forecast
columns.description: Boolean flag indicating if the row represents a forecast period (TRUE) or historical data (FALSE).

columns.name: month_name
columns.description: The full text name of the calendar month (e.g., 'January', 'February').

columns.name: conversion_rate_uncertainty
columns.description: A measure of the relative uncertainty in the conversion rate forecast, calculated as the width of the confidence interval relative to the point forecast. Null for historical periods.

columns.name: roi_uncertainty
columns.description: A measure of the relative uncertainty in the ROI forecast, calculated as the width of the confidence interval relative to the point forecast. Null for historical periods.
